entry.title: Peter Nimble
entry.content:
Peter Nimble and His Fantastic Eyes

Author: Jonathan Auxier

Rating: 10/10

Peter Nimble is a child with extraorinary capabilities, he is a theif in an ordinary town, when he discovers a box of eyes, he embarks on a journey to find a missing island, and discover secrets about his past.

This book was very well writen, and kept the suspense well, the plot was very interesting and enjoyable, with the intriguing twist of the main protaganist being a theif. In conclusion, I really enjoyed this book and would recomend it.

entry.title: Sophie Quire
entry.content:
Sophie Quire and the Last Storyguard

Author: Jonathan Auxier

Rating: 10/10

The Sequel to Peter Nimble and His Fantastic Eyes Sophie Quire and the Last Storyguard takes place in a town where books are hated and burned. One day, Peter Nimble brings her a special book, which unlocks a whole new world of magic. I really liked this book because books were a centeral part of the plot. This book brings back Peter Nimble and Sir Tode, and introduces Sophie and a new villain, who like King Incarnadine, seeks to destroy magic and make things in his city “normal”.

entry.content:
Ranger’s Aprentice - The Ruins of Gorlan

Author: John Flanagan

Rating: 10/10

Ranger’s Aprentice is a series about a boy named Will, who grows up in the ward of Castle Redmond. On Chosing Day, when the children of the ward are chosen as aprentices, Will becomes aprenticed to the mysterious Ranger Halt. Will begins to learn what it means to be a Ranger, and undertakes a dangerous mission, which could have disasterous consequences.

This book grabed me from the start, Will is a very likeable protaganist and the story is very interesting, leaving space for many more adventures. Another thing that I enjoyed about this series is that there is no overarching plot, only single adventures.
